public java.util.ArrayList<PluginType> getPlugins()
Gets a ArrayList of all currently loaded plugins (upcasted to 'PluginType.')

Returns:
The ArrayList of all plugins

addThread

public static java.lang.Thread addThread(java.lang.Runnable t)
Create a thread object of the specified Runnable, adding it to the Snipes thread management register. Please note that this method DOES NOT star the thread. You must use it like SnipesBot.addThread(new ExampleRunnable()).start(); to start the thread. You could also store it in a Object like this: Thread t = SnipesBot.addThread(new ExampleRunnable); //More code to do stuff before actually starting the thread t.start();

Parameters:
t - The runnable to add and create a thread from.
Returns:
The Thread Object of the newly created Thread.

getErrorQueue

public static java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> getErrorQueue()
Gets the current Snipes error Queue object. If you intend on modifying it, you must 'commit' your changes using {#setErrorQueue} so they are seen by other plugins/ objects.

Returns:
The error queue

setErrorQueue

public static boolean setErrorQueue(java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> value)
Set the value of the Snipes error queue. The intended purpose of this method is to remove or add errors to the current error Queue object (retrieved using {#getErrorQueue}.)

Parameters:
value -
Returns:
True if the value was set, false if it wasn't (value was null.)

addToErrorQueue

public static boolean addToErrorQueue(java.lang.String error)
Adds a item to the error message queue. These messages get printed out about every 20 seconds. This is so that they are not missed.

Parameters:
error - The error String to add
Returns:
True if the erorr was added. The error will be added as long as it doesn't equals null or empty.

getThreadCollection

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Thread> getThreadCollection()
Gets the Thread List Object

Returns:
The List Object, containing all currently running Threads

getInst

public static SnipesBot getInst()
                         throws NoSnipesInstanceException
Gets the currently running Snipes instance. This method is expensive, and should not be called often (or at all by plugins).

Returns:
The currently running Snipes instance
Throws:
NoSnipesInstanceException - If the Snipes instance has not been created yet.
SnipesPluginException - If a plugin attempts to call this method.

isBotAdministrator

Checks if the given hostname belongs to a bot administrator or higher.

Parameters:
hostname -
Returns:

isBotOwner

public boolean isBotOwner(java.lang.String hostname)

isBotModerator

public boolean isBotModerator(java.lang.String hostname)

notifyExternalPluginLoad

public boolean notifyExternalPluginLoad(PluginType p)
                                 throws SnipesPluginException
Notifies Snipes that a plugin has been added and needs to be added to the lists. There is no guarantee that this plugin will be accepted and added, but if it is, it's constructor will be called. A exception will be thrown if it cannot or will not be added.

Parameters:
p - The PluginType to add.
Throws:
SnipesPluginException - If Snipes cannot or refuses to load the specified plugin.
